intro: Oreogrammitis pseudolocellata, commonly known as the false moonwort, is a fern that belongs to the family Pterobryaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. The plant has a unique reproductive structure known as a sorus, which is clustered on the underside of the fronds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest floors or rocky crevices. Oreogrammitis pseudolocellata is a rare and specialized species, with a limited geographic distribution.
